column1: Artificial intelligence (AI) is intelligence exhibited by machines. In computer science
column2: an ideal "intelligent" machine is a flexible rational agent that perceives its environment and takes actions that maximize its chance of success at some goal. Colloquially
column3: the term "artificial intelligence" is applied when a machine mimics "cognitive" functions that humans associate with other human minds
column4: such as "learning" and "problem solving". As machines become increasingly capable
column5: facilities once thought to require intelligence are removed from the definition. For example
column6: optical character recognition is no longer perceived as an exemplar of "artificial intelligence" having become a routine technology. Capabilities still classified as AI include advanced Chess and Go systems and self-driving cars.AI research is divided into subfields that focus on specific problems or on specific approaches or on the use of a particular tool or towards satisfying particular applications.
